message.content:
cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.SE 

This paper discusses a hardware-assisted memory protection scheme for safeguarding the operating system from rootkits and kernel-mode malware. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also focuses on operating system integrity, which suggests that it could belong to cs.OS (Operating Systems). Additionally, the paper proposes a low-overhead hardware solution, which could fall under cs.AR (Architecture) or cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper evaluates the energy and silicon overheads of the proposed solution, which could also place it in cs.SE (Software Engineering).
